intro: Iria spadicea var. normalis, commonly known as the common iria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, with five petals and a prominent corona. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks.
